text:
Child Development Services Project I (ICDS I) was supported by the World 
Bank and other donors from 1990-1997, with population coverage of approximately 2.5% ( 41). 
The intensity of CHNWs, known as Anganwadi workers (ANWs) (estimated at 20% FTE) was 
1:1000 persons, i.e. approximately 1:200 children ( 19) or 10:1000 households. While there 
are no definitive evaluations, most reports on ICDS 1 estimate that the change in underweight 
attributable to the programme was slight ( 41, 42); the rat
